results.title: Suspicion
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: A dowdy and repressed young woman, a colonel’s daughter who has led a sheltered life, is irresistibly attracted to a man who is romantic and reckless, a rejection of everything her family background and upbringing have stood for. After their marriage she finds that he is a liar and, she suspects, a murderer. She comes to believe that he plans to murder her. Although the ending is apparently not what Hitchcock originally intended, the film as it now stands does not run counter to his interest in the themes of paranoia and the fragility of relationships. Cast includes Cary Grant, Joan Fontaine, Sir Cedric Hardwicke, Nigel Bruce and Dame May Whitty. Adapted from the novel ‘Before the Fact’ by Francis Iles.

results.title: Jacob's ladder
results.creator_credit: Adrian Lyne, Alan Marshall and Carolco Pictures
results.brief_description: Jacob Singer is a Vietnam veteran working as a postman who is deeply haunted by a horrible experience in battle, the details of which he cannot clearly recall. When strange and violent hallucinations begin to invade his everyday life, together with the discovery that his fellow battalion members are also seeing the same demons, he begins to suspect covert Army involvement. As the visions become darker and more terrifying, he suffers severe panic attacks related to the chaos that may be reality or that may merely exist in his own mind. Cast includes: Tim Robbins, Elizabeth Pena, Danny Aiello, Matt Craven, Pruitt Taylor Vince and Jason Alexander.

results.title: Buena vista social club
results.creator_credit: Wim Wenders, Deepak Nayar, Ulrich Felsburg, Arte, ICAIC, Kintop Pictures and Road Movies
results.brief_description: Ry Cooder went to Cuba in 1996 to meet with a group of legendary musicians of the 1930’s, 40’s and 50’s. The result was the Grammy Award winning album Buena Vista Social Club. When Cooder travelled to Cuba again in 1998 to record a solo album with Ibrahim Ferrer - again with all the musicians of the Buena Vista Social Club - Wim Wenders accompanied him with a small film crew, observing the musicians in the studio and tracing their lives in Havana.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wim Wenders, Deepak Nayar, Ulrich Felsburg, Arte, ICAIC, Kintop Pictures and Road Movies

results.title: Project X
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Kaplan, Lawrence Lasker, Walter Parkes and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Pilot Jimmy Garrett (Mathew Broderick) finds himself working on a special military assignment as punishment when he is grounded for misconduct. His mission is to teach chimpanzees to fly through the use of flight simulators, and he quickly discovers an affinity with the animals who he begins communicating with. When he befriends researcher Teri (Helen Hunt) and her number one student, a chimpanzee called Virgil she has successfully taught sign language to, Garrett discovers something that wasn’t in the brief - the real purpose of “Project X” is to test the limits of human endurance by subjecting the experimental primates to radiation. Teri and Jimmy are forced to question their loyalties to science, their careers, and the animals that have become friends. Cast also includes Bill Sadler, Johnny Ray McGhee and Jonathan Stark.

results.title: Rio Negro = Black River
results.creator_credit: Manuel Perez, Santiago Llapur and ICAIC
results.brief_description: The drama begins on the morning of 17 April 1961, as news of the Bay of Pigs invasion reaches the Black River area of the Escambray Mountains in central Cuba. Tirso Fabre, a militiaman and member of the Black River co-operative farm, and Chano Carrillo, a counterrevolutionary hiding behind his front as a Castro sympathizer, receive the news in different ways, in line with their antagonistic ideological positions. The film traces a long-running personal feud between the two men of which the roots go back to the pre-revolutionary years, in a story told in flashback and flashforward. Cast includes Sergio Corrieri and Nelson Villagra. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Arlington Road
results.creator_credit: Mark Pellington, Marc Samuelson, Peter Samuelson, Tom Gorai and Lakeshore Entertainment
results.brief_description: After his FBI agent wife is killed by an extremist group, college professor Michael Faraday moves his son and himself to a new neighborhood, to make a fresh start. Driving home from work one day he saves the life of a boy, the son of his neighbours Oliver and Cheryl Lang. Becoming friends with the Langs’, Michael’s life begins to improve, he has a new girlfriend, his son is happy, and he has a job teaching American History at the local college - specialising in terrorism and extremist activities. Soon he begins to notice details of Oliver’s stories don’t add up. Are his neighbours as normal as they seem? Cast includes Jeff Bridges, Tim Robbins and Joan Cusack.

results.title: Akira Kurosawa's Dreams = Dreams
results.creator_credit: Akira Kurosawa, Hisao Kurosawa, Mike Y Inoue, Steven Spielberg, Akira Kurosawa USA Productions and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: This Japanese-American co-production can be regarded as Kurosawa’s last personal philosophic and cinematic testament as he explores in eight vignettes the cost of war, the perils of nuclear warfare, and above all man’s need to harmonise with nature. It is Kurosawa’s belief that, ‘Man is genius when he dreams’, and his visions are here, superbly realised in Takao Sato and Masaharu Ueda’s sunny cinematography. In Japanese with English subtitles. Cast includes Martin Scorsese and Akire Terao.

results.title: Bhowani Junction
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, Pandro S. Berman and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: In what is considered by many fans to be her best performance, Ava Gardner stars as the heroine Victoria Jones, a woman forced to make some painful life decisions in post Colonial India. Her relationship with three men; Colonel Savage (Stewart Granger) a British military man in charge of protecting trains crossing Bhowani Junction, fellow Anglo-Indian Patrick Taylor (Bill Travers), and Sikh communist Peter Illing who befriends Victoria after she kills a potential rapist in self defence - challenging her to assess where her loyalties and ethnicity lie. Adapted from the novel by John Masters.

results.title: The Last days
results.creator_credit: James Moll, June Beallor, Ken Lipper, Steven Spielberg and Survivors of the Shoah Visual History Foundation
results.brief_description: In late 1944, at great cost while Germany was losing the war, Hitler brought the Holocaust to Hungary. In one of the last centers of Jewish culture, the Nazis deported and killed 425,000 people in just sixty days. This documentary is a moving and compelling account of five Hungarian survivors, tracing their lives from the present, back to the “cleansing” of Hungary and the devastation of the concentration camps. It is an outgrowth of the Survivors of the Shoah Visual History Foundation. Created by Steven Spielberg in 1994 after he filmed ‘Schindler’s List’, the organization is dedicated to recording the oral histories of as many Holocaust survivors as possible before they die. Music by Hans Zimmer.

results.title: The Purple plain
results.creator_credit: Robert Parrish, John Bryan, Rank Organisation Film Productions and Two Cities Films
results.brief_description: This psychological wartime drama set in Burma was based on the novel by H.E. Bates. A Canadian pilot (Gregory Peck) and two comrades-in-arms crash in the Burmese wilds. The three men are forced to hack their way through the jungle to safety, surrounded on all sides by the Japanese. The pilot’s subordinates don’t completely trust their leader, and not without reason - his nerves have been at breaking point for months. Faced with this severe test of courage and endurance, he must muster the physical and mental resources to lead his men to safety. Cast includes Maurice Denham, Win Min Than, Lyndon Brook, Anthony Bushell and Josephone Griffin.
